This page allows CTA authors to change their signature and affiliations for papers managed by SAPO.

Change of signature

Authors can choose change the name used by SAPO using the FIRST NAME and LAST NAME fields. Unicode characters can be used as desired. The author's signature, which will be used to CTA papers, is shown in the SIGNATURE field. The signature comprises the initials of the first name(s), and all of the second name(s)

For example, with

  • FIRST NAME="Alpha-Beta Gamma", and
  • LAST NAME="delta Epsilon Zêta-Eta"
the author's signature would be
  • "A.-B. G. delta Epsilon Zêta-Eta".

You can also supply your ORCID id (as a URL) if you wish this to be added to you signature for journals that accept it.

Change of affiliations

Authors can manage their affiliations by selecting the institutions they are affiliated with in the fields at the bottom of the page. All authors can specify a primary and secondary affiliation from the database maintained by SAPO. Exceptionally, authors can request SAPO add a third affiliation by contacting SAPO by email and explain the circumstances.

If the address for your affiliation is not correct, please click on the address to see the entry for this affilation, and contact the MANAGER listed on the page to request it be changed, or SAPO if no manager is given

Finally, if your institution is not present in the list, please contact SAPO by email and explain the circumstances.

{{/html}}
